Key Match Events: England secured a penalty shootout victory over Switzerland in the Euro 2024 quarter-final.
The match went into a penalty shootout after the scores were level at 1-1.
England's players scored all their penalties, including key contributions from Cole Palmer, Jude Bellingham, Bukayo Saka, Ivan Toney, and Trent Alexander-Arnold.
Switzerland's Xherdan Shaqiri and Zeki Amdouni scored penalties, but England's Pickford saved two of their attempts.
Pre-Game Insights: England manager Gareth Southgate implemented a 'buddy system' to support penalty-takers and maintain team cohesion.
Southgate only gathered players who were on the pitch at extra time, excluding substitutes and Harry Kane.
The team's penalty preparation involved meticulous planning and strategies to handle each potential opponent.
Post-Match Reflections: Gareth Southgate praised England's penalty preparation and adaptability after the win.
The victory marked England's third semi-final win in four tournaments under Southgate.
Miscellaneous Highlights: England's deliberate approach and control during the shootout, highlighted by their average 5.2-second run-up time.
Goalkeeper Jordan Pickford used distraction tactics and detailed notes to save penalties.
The psychological impact of early saves and the confidence it brought to England's players.
